content.description: Start in pockets, move to jug under roof, hit crimp up right, sloper up left, heel hook left, and your up.

SDS and move up and left on good holds, following the sloping rail, before moving out left on some single pad holds, then up and right into the scoop. The hardest moves were in the overhang, but getting up and on top of the scoop proved to be the most physical section.Â
content.location: If you are facing the boulder with Flash Gordon, do a 180 turnaround, and walk a minute the other direction (to the south I think). The boulder is easily visible, is quite tall, and has a spire that resembles a gnomes hat. The problem climbs the west face. Sit down start, go up and left on an obvious rail feature, then up and right into a scoop to topout.

content.description: This route begins on jugs beneath the prow.  Work through underclings crimps and a tenuous match on the prow to gain the lip and hold the crux swing.  A genuine classic for the area.  There is some sneaky beta that revolves around a right toe hook that for the tall can make this climb much easier.
content.location: This route is on the backside of the Middle East boulder (on the opposite side of Flash Gordon, Anti-Hero, Loved by Few and Bald Eagle.

content.description: Start on a triangle crimp/pinch with the right hand and an undercling with the left. powerful moves lead you to the crux lunge out of the undercling. The sit start to this is Anti-Hero (V13).
content.location: on the opposite side of Jeff's Prow

content.description: Down from Flash Gordon, start on the chalked up not quite jug; up over the lip to top out.
content.location: Swiss Chard Boulder-same side as Flash Gordon

content.description: Right of Jeff's Prow, follow top out.
content.protection: Uneven landing, bring a couple pads, 3 or 4 is preferable.

content.description: Start low on a pair of small crimps moving up and left to the jug rail. Continue left and finish on Flash Gordon.
Start on a low rail on the right side of the boulder. Move right hand to a small slot. Head towards a jug underneath the arete. Make a long move to a crimp on the state. Committing top.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: South side of the Swiss Chard Boulder.

content.description: Sit start low on the hanging arete. Climb the arete to jugs and drop off or continue to the top.
There is plenty of bouldering here. Probably 40+ established problems and at least one hard project.
